We can write a helper function or inline code.

Alternatively, inline it.

In code:

#include <stdio.h>

int main() {

    int li[1002]; // size enough
    int li_len =0;
    
    for(int i=1; i<=370; i++) {
        int p =i;
        int count=0;
        while(p !=0) {
            p = p/10;
            count++;
        }
        if(count ==1) {
            li[li_len++] = i;
        } else {
            int temp[3];
            int temp_count =0;
            int q =i;
            while(q!=0) {
                temp[temp_count] = q%10;
                q = q/10;
                temp_count++;
            }
            // now add in reverse order
            for(int j = temp_count-1; j >=0; j--) {
                li[li_len++] = temp[j];
            }
        }
    }
    
    // now subtract two pops
    li_len -=2;
    
    int n;
    scanf("%d", &n);
    // Check if n is within 1 to 1000 (since after pops, li is length 1000)
    // but let's assume input is valid.
    printf("%d\n", li[n-1]);
    
    return 0;
}
